Yes. Below is a complete, end-to-end spec you can hand to yourself or an engineer. Iâ€™m keeping it concrete, opinionated, and aligned with your existing sheet + mode system. No fluff.

â¸»

Solids Feeding â€” Half-Sheet Spec

1. Scope & goals

Goal
	â€¢	Add a third feeding mode: Solids
	â€¢	Enable fast, low-friction logging of solid food exposure
	â€¢	Preserve your existing half-sheet mental model
	â€¢	Avoid inventing new navigation patterns beyond one controlled variant

Non-goals
	â€¢	Precise nutrition tracking
	â€¢	Calorie / gram accuracy
	â€¢	Meal classification (breakfast/lunch/dinner)
	â€¢	Mandatory data entry

â¸»

2. Entry point

Where
	â€¢	Existing Feeding half-sheet

Mode selector

[Bottle] [Nursing] [Solids]

Selecting Solids replaces the body of the sheet (same behavior as Nursing today).

â¸»

	â€¢	Start time
	â€¢	Required

	â€¢	No other validation required

â¸»

4. Recent foods behavior

What counts as recent
	â€¢	Last N solid foods logged for this kid
	â€¢	Flat list
	â€¢	No pinning
	â€¢	No weighting

Interaction
	â€¢	Tap a chip â†’ food is added immediately
	â€¢	Newly added food auto-expands (recommended)
	â€¢	No confirmation
	â€¢	No picker involved

â¸»

5. Add food â†’ Food picker (inline slide)

Transition behavior
	â€¢	The body of the half-sheet slides horizontally
	â€¢	Header remains fixed
	â€¢	This is a sheet variant, not a modal, not a nav push

â¸»

Icon guidance (quick)
	â€¢	See above

â¸»

In addition to the Solids half-sheet UI and interaction flows described above, the following integrations and updates are required:
	1.	Firebase logging
	    â€¢	Solid feeding events must be logged to Firebase.
	    â€¢	Each solid feeding log must be associated with a specific kid.
	2.	TrackerCard (Solids)
	    â€¢	A new Solids TrackerCard must be created.
	    â€¢	(Design and behavior of the TrackerCard are out of scope for this spec.)
	3.	FeedDetailTab
	    â€¢	Solid feeding events must render as solid feeding mini cards in the FeedDetailTab.
	    â€¢	(Layout and visual design of these mini cards are out of scope for this spec.)
	4.	Show / Hide Activities logic
	    â€¢	A new row and toggle for Solid Feedings must be added to the showAndHideActivities.js logic.
	    â€¢	Solid feeding events must respect this toggle everywhere feeds are rendered.
	5.	Feeding half-sheet mode
	    â€¢	Solids must be implemented as a third mode within the existing Feeding half-sheet, alongside Bottle and Nursing.
